docs.snippet: For 13 glorious days in Brazil the feel-good factor flourished at the World Cup as the football flowed, the goals gushed and fans reveled in the tournament's return to its spiritual home.
docs.lead_paragraph: For 13 glorious days in Brazil the feel-good factor flourished at the World Cup as the football flowed, the goals gushed and fans reveled in the tournament's return to its spiritual home.

headline.main: Suarez Bite and Ban Steals the First Round Spotlight
headline.print_headline: Suarez Bite and Ban Steals the First Round Spotlight

docs.snippet: Authorities in major Colombia cities are again imposing bans on alcohol and curfews for minors Saturday to discourage mayhem on a big World Cup game day. Some are even banning motorcycles.
docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities in major Colombia cities are again imposing bans on alcohol and curfews for minors Saturday to discourage mayhem on a big World Cup game day. Some are even banning motorcycles.

headline.main: Colombia Mayors Regulate World Cup Merrymaking
headline.print_headline: Colombia Mayors Regulate World Cup Merrymaking

docs.snippet: Colombia coach Jose Pekerman avoided questions about Luis Suarez, ducked any assessment of the striker's punishment and didn't mention his name ahead of Saturday's World Cup second-round match against Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia coach Jose Pekerman avoided questions about Luis Suarez, ducked any assessment of the striker's punishment and didn't mention his name ahead of Saturday's World Cup second-round match against Uruguay.

headline.main: No Mention of Suarez by Colombia's Pekerman
headline.print_headline: No Mention of Suarez by Colombia's Pekerman

docs.snippet: Some of Latin America's most prominent leftists are accusing football's world governing body FIFA of banning star striker Luis Suarez as a ploy to sideline his Uruguayan team from a World Cup brimming with Latin flavour and European flops.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some of Latin America's most prominent leftists are accusing football's world governing body FIFA of banning star striker Luis Suarez as a ploy to sideline his Uruguayan team from a World Cup brimming with Latin flavour and European flops.

headline.main: Latin American Leftists See Red Over Suarez Ban
headline.print_headline: Latin American Leftists See Red Over Suarez Ban

docs.snippet: Uruguay coach Oscar Tabarez accused FIFA of an indiscriminate use of power by imposing an "excessive" punishment on striker Luis Suarez and he said he would resign from positions he holds within world football's governing body.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay coach Oscar Tabarez accused FIFA of an indiscriminate use of power by imposing an "excessive" punishment on striker Luis Suarez and he said he would resign from positions he holds within world football's governing body.

headline.main: Uruguay Coach Hits Out at FIFA Over Suarez Ban
headline.print_headline: Uruguay Coach Hits Out at FIFA Over Suarez Ban

docs.snippet: Uruguay coach Oscar Tabarez quit FIFA's strategic committee on Friday in protest at the ban football's governing body imposed on his team's star striker Luis Suarez for biting an Italian player.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay coach Oscar Tabarez quit FIFA's strategic committee on Friday in protest at the ban football's governing body imposed on his team's star striker Luis Suarez for biting an Italian player.

headline.main: Uruguay Coach Quits FIFA Position Over Suarez Ban
headline.print_headline: Uruguay Coach Quits FIFA Position Over Suarez Ban

docs.snippet: The second round of the World Cup gets underway on Saturday with host nation Brazil facing Chile and Colombia taking on Uruguay in an all-South American race to reach the quarterfinals.
docs.lead_paragraph: The second round of the World Cup gets underway on Saturday with host nation Brazil facing Chile and Colombia taking on Uruguay in an all-South American race to reach the quarterfinals.

headline.main: Host Brazil Takes Center Stage at World Cup
headline.print_headline: Host Brazil Takes Center Stage at World Cup

docs.snippet: The furor over Luis Suarez's heavy ban for biting filled the void of the first game-free day at the World Cup in Brazil on Friday, with his Italian victim Giorgio Chiellini leading the criticism of the Uruguayan's record punishment.
docs.lead_paragraph: The furor over Luis Suarez's heavy ban for biting filled the void of the first game-free day at the World Cup in Brazil on Friday, with his Italian victim Giorgio Chiellini leading the criticism of the Uruguayan's record punishment.

headline.main: Disgraced Suarez Goes Home, Brazil Feel Pressure
headline.print_headline: Disgraced Suarez Goes Home, Brazil Feel Pressure

docs.snippet: Luis Suárez has a wonderful talent and a match winner’s mentality, but he cannot be allowed such unacceptable behavior.

headline.main: If Suárez Would Only Depend on His Talent
headline.print_headline: If Suárez Would Only Depend on His Talent

docs.snippet: Global soccer has taken some well-earned flak in recent years, but this edition of the game's showcase event has been a golden ticket to compelling action.
docs.lead_paragraph: Global soccer has taken some well-earned flak in recent years, but this edition of the game's showcase event has been a golden ticket to compelling action.
docs.abstract: Christopher Clarey On Soccer column argues that 2014 World Cup has been marked by exceptional action, dynamic play and stunning upsets; notes that only six teams from oft-dominant Europe have made it to the second round, the lowest number in cup history, reflecting rise of teams from the Americas and elsewhere.

headline.main: A World Cup of the Americas Ends Upbeat First Phase
headline.print_headline: Americas Rise in Thrilling First Phase
